paragraphs.text: My commitment was immediately put to the test. I was at my brother’s house (a no-shoes household), and we had dimmed the lights so we could watch a movie. I was walking back to his living room with a bowl of freshly-popped popcorn, when suddenly a solid wood table leg appeared out of the shadows.

My commitment was immediately put to the test. I was at my brother’s house (a no-shoes household), and we had dimmed the lights so we could watch a movie. I was walking back to his living room with a bowl of freshly-popped popcorn, when suddenly a solid wood table leg appeared out of the shadows.

paragraphs.name: 0ad0
paragraphs.text: I can now just say what’s on my mind, confident that, while some people may take issue with my ideas, they probably won’t flinch at the words I use.

4017507693fc.title: I have found, by age 79, that withholding cuss words from my vocabulary through many decades has…

paragraphs.name: 04cb
paragraphs.text: I have found, by age 79, that withholding cuss words from my vocabulary through many decades has enhanced the effect of those cusswords now that I’m an old lady. Eyebrows go up when I say a potty word or that frack word . It’s an excellent bit of spice when you want people to hear what grandma is saying.

a48dfd18bac2.title: I need to give this a try.

paragraphs.name: 407a
paragraphs.text: I need to give this a try. One of my daynightmares (I can’t call it a daydream) is that my son will become a stand-up comedian. I have given him tons of material, but cussing like a sailor when I’m angry while scolding him for every four letter word he utters surely will be front and center in his repertoire. Auch.

d5325394f009.title: People ask me why I don’t swear.

paragraphs.name: bcc3
paragraphs.text: People ask me why I don’t swear. Now I understand why I’ve never wanted to go back. It feels good to have stoic thoughtful silence when others are furiously expelling expletives.

8d6f8627ca92.title: they are just words, when you say frack your mind thinks fuck.

paragraphs.name: 5e71
paragraphs.text: they are just words, when you say frack your mind thinks fuck. what does it change? the problem is why that word is considered offensive when it’s just a part of life, and a big one. there is a taboo, and by not saying the word we keep it alive.

a8b79106db21.title: It’s been 20 years for me. Not a perfect 20 years, but darn near.

paragraphs.text: It’s been 20 years for me. Not a perfect 20 years, but darn near.

I have used the f-word twice in those twenty years. Both times, the people present just stood there, silent, jaws dropped. Both times, it was on purpose to let those around me know I wasn’t happy. Dramatic effect? You have no idea.

846fe8a158ff.title: At first, this article’s title did not grab me.

paragraphs.name: d432
paragraphs.text: At first, this article’s title did not grab me. In fact, it did the opposite. I am not a fan of censorship. I am, however, a fan of willpower, discretion, discernment, and professionalism. So, I decided to give it a go. I read the article. It’s worth reading. Instead of it anti-cussing it is pro-willpower. I am going to give it a try. Thanks for this thoughful piece.

f1bd247983e0.title: Frankly, I see swearing and a creative outburst of emotion, nothing wrong with it at all.

paragraphs.text: Frankly, I see swearing and a creative outburst of emotion, nothing wrong with it at all. But each to there own Quincy.

e86961f8c6c7.title: I swear so frequently and casually that I can’t see this having any benefit on me nor do I even…

paragraphs.name: fa05
paragraphs.text: I swear so frequently and casually that I can’t see this having any benefit on me nor do I even have any desire to do it. I don’t really understand the reasons behind stopping swearing and an increase in willpower, there was no real explanation for it in my opinion. I think this would only have benefits to the type of person who uses expletives…
